3.title: Charities That Changed the World
3.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Celebrity Charities
1.plot: Dr. Leigh-Davis profiles some world famous celebrities and the charities they love.

2.title: Charity Beach Events
2.plot: Dr. Leigh-Davis hosts this episode of "Profiles in Philanthropy," (formerly, and also known as "Los Angeles Philanthropic Endeavors,") which visits beaches of different latitudes to focus on charitable events occurring over the summer: from a 007 James Bond charity party in South Beach Florida; to across the pond to Great Britain; and then back to Miami. Featured stories include Snoop Dog and a House auctioned for charity, as well as, a story on Diana Ross and other top music artists, singing on Nile Rodgers "We Are Family" record. Also, a special, special, special ...

2.title: Music for Japan
2.plot: Dr. Leigh-Davis profiles the musicians and celebrities that came together to aid the victims of the 2011 tsunami in Japan. This episode includes footage from the MTV special, as well as, Justin Bieber and Lady Gaga raising awareness about how people can help. Lots of great music, with several live musical performances.

8.title: Athletes for Charity
8.plot: Dr. Leigh-Davis hosts this episode of "Profiles in Philanthropy," which is an insider's view of athletes and the charitable work they do; when they're not scoring points. From Kobe Bryant; to King James; to Steve Nash; to David Beckham. In fact, "P in P" goes to the mansion of Victoria and David Beckham, for a star-studded charity event. Also, (we almost forgot,) a special message from Brad Pitt. "Profiles in Philanthropy" is a news magazine TV show, which reports on any and all philanthropic endeavors occurring in the world, and the people behind them. In addition to...

6.title: The Changing Times of Philanthropy
6.plot: Profiles in Philanthropy and Dr. Leigh-Davis explore how philanthropic endeavors have changed focus over the centuries, and what may be expected in the future. A worldwide look is taken of what the word "charity" has meant to different people at different times. Top celebrities weigh in on how politics, the economy, and war have changed the focus of philanthropy over the years.

locations: Paramount Studios - 5555 Melrose Avenue, Hollywood, Los Angeles, California, USA
imdb.plot outline: "Profiles in Philanthropy" is a news magazine TV show, which reports on any and all philanthropic endeavors occurring in the world, and the people behind them. In addition to being informative, this program is presented in an entertaining manner, designed to: 1) Make the public aware of philanthropic endeavors; 2) Encourage volunteerism; 3) Provide information to people in need; and 4) Motivate the public to engage in philanthropic activities.
imdb.title: Profiles in Philanthropy
